text: The Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) is a part of the United Nations. The purpose of this agency is to protect and support refugees when governments or the UN ask for help. The UNHCR helps refugees return home out of their voluntary will, settle locally, or move to a third country according to the Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees and other international law. The agency's headquarters are in Geneva, Switzerland. It is a member of the United Nations Development Group chaired by United Nations Development Programme. The UNHCR has won two Nobel Peace Prizes in 1954 and in 1981. ==List of High Commissioners== # Photo High Commissioners Nationality Time – 1922–1927 League of Nations High Commissioner 1 1951–1956 2 1956–1960 3 1960–1965 4 1965–1977 5 1978–1985 6 1986–1989 7 1990 8 1990–2000 9 2001–2005 (Resign due to internal investigation) 10 2005–2015 11 2016–present ==Related pages== *Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees ==References== *
title: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
